components.name: Fastlane Client
components.description: The Fastlane client is a command-line tool and GUI application used by developers to interact with the Lane service. It executes automation tasks and provides a user interface for managing workflows.

components.name: Lane Service
components.description: The Lane service is the core of Fastlane. It's a backend service that manages workflows, interacts with various platforms (iOS, Android, etc.), and handles the execution of automation tasks.

components.name: Platform Integrations
components.description: These are the various integrations Fastlane uses to interact with different mobile platforms (e.g., Xcode, Android Studio, Google Cloud Build).

data_flows.description: Developers use the Fastlane client to submit workflows and task definitions to the Lane service for execution.
The Lane service communicates with platform integrations (e.g., Xcode, Android Studio) to execute tasks like building, testing, and deploying apps.
Platform integrations provide status updates and results back to the Fastlane client.

trust_boundaries.name: Developer Environment
trust_boundaries.description: The environment where developers build and run Fastlane. This boundary includes the developer's machine, IDE, and any locally installed Fastlane components.

trust_boundaries.name: Lane Service Infrastructure
trust_boundaries.description: The infrastructure hosting the Lane service, including servers, databases, and network components.

trust_boundaries.name: Platform Integrations Environment
trust_boundaries.description: The environment where platform integrations (e.g., Xcode, Android Studio) are deployed and run.
